it does work. just do the following
-install the demo and overwrite the fix files(install the sound pack if you wish)

-then change your system date to 29th oct 2009 and timezone to Moscow( you'll avoid "no permission" error)

-then download and install steam create a new steam account then shut down steam

-google for "undead steam patch"  download and crack steam

-start steam and run the demo from "left4dead2.exe"  

have fun

Hi Guys, I got it working finally after 2 hours of banging my head..., i tried all things, but this is the way it works as said by other members..
1. Install l4d2 demo.
2. Change date to October 29, 2009, and TIME ZONE to Moscow, St. Petersberg, Volgograd.
3. Download and install steam and create a new account, let steam update and log out of it.
4. For some reason, I don't feel the undead crack supplied in demo is working properly, so go to http://cs.rin.ru/forum/viewtopic.php?t=44153 and download UnDead666_SASiO_22092009.rar [73.26 KiB]
5. Unzip all the files into c:\Program Files\Steam folder, which is where the default installation of steam would be..
6. Double click on UnDead - Install & Launch.bat
7. Log back into steam.
8. Launch the game by click on RUN_L4D2.exe

This is the way it worked for me, provided I am a noob with the system.. Excuse me if the details are too long, i just wanted to help other piratebayers who badly want to play this game :), if it works, thank other people who made this work and kick some zombies ASS

Got it working in multiplayer on LAN, didn't play any though, just saw that we could connect to each other and move around and shoot. Slashed off some heads and tried falling off the building a few times.

One of us had steam installed (not updated to the latest version), I didn't have steam installed. Both are on Vista 64.

This is how we did it:

Installed the game, only thing we changed in the installer was that we selected "English". Haven't installed any fix or english sound package (voices seem to be english in-game, russian in cut scenes).

1) Everybody start the game with -console
Example: Make a shortcut that leads to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Left 4 Dead 2\RUN_L4D2.exe" -console

2) The guy hosting: In the console, type "sv_lan 1", then "net_start" then type "map " and press TAB
to select a map. Press ENTER to start game.

3) The guys joining: In the console, type "connect X", where X is the ip number of the guy hosting.

These are my notes from Left 4 Dead 1, havent checked if they work in L4D2 but they probably do:

Tip: "name Blabla" will give you the nickname "Blabla".

If the game crashes for someone he can simply rejoin by writing "connect X" again, but the guy
hosting have to kick him first from the game by writing "kick X" in the console, where X is the
nickname of the guy that crashed. The compuer will play the role of the kicked player until he
joins again.

Select a map with "vs" to be able to play as both humans and zombies. Press "m" to change team.

So, as I've said, haven't checked that much but at least I know it's possible to connect to each other (why shouldnt it work since it did in left4dead1 and this is just the first game with some additions, same "engine" in the back so to speak). Good luck and have a good game!
